content.webTitle: Trump: ‘I thought it would be easier’ | The minute

fields.headline: Trump: ‘I thought it would be easier’
fields.bodyText: In a remarkable interview with Reuters to mark his first 100 days as president (tomorrow’s the day; light a candle), Donald Trump opened up about the stresses of the job and his transformation from reality TV star to top most-powerful human. Read interview highlights I loved my previous life. I had so many things going. This is more work than in my previous life. I thought it would be easier. You’re really into your own little cocoon ... I like to drive. I can’t drive anymore. – Donald Trump Trump also shared a surprisingly sympathetic appraisal of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. “He’s 27 years old, his father dies, took over a regime, so say what you want but that’s not easy, especially at that age ... I’m just saying that’s a very hard thing to do.” Village on the front line “There’s a chance that we could end up having a major, major, conflict with North Korea, absolutely,” Trump said. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson urged new sanctions on North Korea, warning of ‘catastrophic consequences’ otherwise.
